intro: Erysimum kuemmerlei, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in the spring and early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Erysimum kuemmerlei is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant color and ease of care.
